properties.areaDesc: Daviess, KY; Vanderburgh, IN; Henderson, KY; Spencer, IN; Warrick, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:19AM CST until February 24 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Kentucky...Illinois...

Ohio River at Owensboro...Newburgh Dam...Evansville...Mount Vernon
...J.T. Myers Dam...Shawneetown and Golconda

.The Ohio River from Owensboro down to Golconda continues to rise.
All seven of these points are expected to crest in the minor flood category
between Tuesday and Friday. The only exception is Shawneetown,
which is forecast to rise to moderate flood category on Tuesday.
The Ohio river will start to fall slowly with several points
forecast to fall below flood stage late this week and early next week.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River at Newburgh Dam.
* until Monday February 24.
* At  9:00 AM Monday the stage was 46.0 feet.
* Flood Stage is 38.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue  to rise and crest near
46.0 feet by Tuesday afternoon. The river will fall below flood
stage next Monday morning, February 24.
* Impact...At 46.0 Feet...Highway 662 near the old Lock and Dam 47
begins to flood. This is approximately 1/2 mile downstream from the
current lock and dam.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
